prompt: <description>**CAD Model Instructions** **Part 1** Construct a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom. It has a smooth surface and appears to be a solid, three-dimensional shape. The object is symmetrical along its central axis. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at (0.0117, 0.0117, 0). For the 2D sketch, create a new face and draw two circles on this face. The first circle should have a center at (0.293, 0.293) and a radius of 0.293. The second circle should have the same center but a radius of 0.0233. Scale the 2D sketch by 0.5859. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector [0.0117, 0.0117, 0.0]. Extrude the 3D sketch by 0.75 units along the normal direction. The length, width, and height of this part are 0.5859, 0.5859, and 0.75 units, respectively. **Part 2** Create a simple, circular, hollow object with a smooth, curved surface. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at (0, 0, 0.75). For the 2D sketch, create a new face and draw two circles on this face. The first circle should have a center at (0.3047, 0.3047) and a radius of 0.3047. The second circle should have the same center but a radius of 0.293. Scale the 2D sketch by 0.6094. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.75]. Extrude the 3D sketch by 0.0166 units along the opposite normal direction. The length, width, and height of this part are 0.6094, 0.6094, and 0.0166 units, respectively. **Part 3** Create a simple, cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, connected by a straight, vertical line. The object is centered in the image. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at (0.3025, 0.3025, 0.75). For the 2D sketch, create a new face and draw a circle on this face. The circle should have a center at (0.0022, 0.0022) and a radius of 0.0022. Scale the 2D sketch by 0.0043. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector [0.3025, 0.3025, 0.75]. Extrude the 3D sketch by 0.0586 units along the opposite normal direction. The length, width, and height of this part are 0.0043, 0.0043, and 0.0586 units, respectively. **Part 4** Create a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The prism is composed of two larger rectangles and one smaller rectangle, all connected by straight lines. The smaller rectangle is positioned in the center of the larger rectangles. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at (0.0704, 0.2344, 0.75). For the 2D sketch, create two new faces and draw the four lines for each rectangle on each face. For the first face, the lines should have the following start and end points: [0.0, 0.0], [0.1406, 0.0], [0.1406, 0.1406], and [0.0, 0.1406]. For the second face, the lines should have the following start and end points: [0.3279, 0.0], [0.4685</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered Top and Bottom** **2D Sketch Creation:** Create a new coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.75, 0.0]. Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Draw a circle (circle\\_1) on the sketch with center at [0.0609, 0.0609] and radius of 0.0609. The circle should be located at approximately 0.0609 units above the origin of the coordinate system. Close the loop (loop\\_1) containing circle\\_1. **Extrusion Step:** Extrude the sketch along the Z direction by 0.1219 units (extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal) and no extrusion in the opposite direction (extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal). Apply scaling of 0.1219 (sketch\\_scale) to the sketch before extrusion. Use the New Body Feature operation for the extrusion step. **Part 2: Tapered Cylindrical Object (if applicable)** **2D Sketch Creation:** Create a new coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.0, <part\\_1\\_height>]. Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Draw a circle (circle\\_1) in the sketch with center at [0.0609, 0.0609] and radius of 0.0609. Close the loop (loop\\_1) containing circle\\_1. **Extrusion Step:** Extrude the sketch along the Z direction by (<part\\_1\\_height> - <part\\_2\\_height>) units (extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal) and no extrusion in the opposite direction (extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal). Apply scaling of 0.1219 (sketch\\_scale) to the sketch before extrusion. Use the Join or Add Material operation for the extrusion step. **Part 3: Bottom Flat Surface of Cylindrical Object (if applicable)** **2D Sketch Creation:** Create a new coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector [0.0, -<part\\_2\\_height>, 0.0]. Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Draw a circle (circle\\_1) in the sketch with center at [0.0609, 0.0609] and radius of 0.0609. Close the loop (loop\\_1) containing circle\\_1. **Extrusion Step:** Extrude the sketch along the Z direction by <part\\_2\\_height> units (extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal) and no extrusion in the opposite direction (extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal). Apply scaling of 0.1219 (sketch\\_scale) to the sketch before extrusion. Use the Join or Add Material operation for the extrusion step. Confirm if the final height is equal to <part\\_1\\_height>. If not, provide adjustments accordingly in the previous parts.</description>

<description>Part 1: Construction of a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0708, 0.0913, 0.0] Sketch a rectangle on the XY plane, defined by the following lines: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.6792, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.6792, 0.0], End Point [0.6792, 0.4477] * Line 3: Start Point [0.6792, 0.4477], End Point [0.0, 0.4477] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.4477], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.6792. Transform the sketch into 3D using the given parameters. Extrude the sketch in the normal direction by 0.0232 units and in the opposite direction by 0.0 units. Part 2: Construction of a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.1094, 0.1299, 0.0232] Sketch a rectangle on the XY plane, defined by the following lines: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.602, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.602, 0.0], End Point [0.602, 0.3705] * Line 3: Start Point [0.602, 0.3705], End Point [0.0, 0.3705] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.3705], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.602. Transform the sketch into 3D using the given parameters. Extrude the sketch in the normal direction by 0.2316 units and in the opposite direction by 0.0 units. Perform a join operation between this part and the previous part. The final assembly will be a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, slightly angled front face, and a tapered top. The length and width are both 0.602 units, and the height is 0.2547 units.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Flat Top and Bottom, and a Hole in the Center of the Top** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1. The euler angles are [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector is [0.0, 0.125, 0.0]. *Face 1:* Draw the first 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system. - Loop 1: - Line 1: Start Point is [0.125, 0.0]; End Point is [0.125, 0.0859]. - Arc 1: Start Point is [0.125, 0.0859]; Mid Point is [0.0859, 0.125]; End Point is [0.125, 0.1641]. *Face 2:* Draw the second 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system. - Loop 1: - Line 1: Start Point is [0.125, 0.0]; End Point is [0.125, 0.0859]. - Arc 1: Start Point is [0.125, 0.0859]; Mid Point is [0.1641, 0.125]; End Point is [0.125, 0.1641]. - Line 2: Start Point is [0.125, 0.1641]; End Point is [0.125, 0.25]. - Line 3: Start Point is [0.125, 0.25]; End Point is [0.625, 0.25]. - Line 4: Start Point is [0.625, 0.25]; End Point is [0.625, 0.1641]. - Arc 2: Start Point is [0.625, 0.1641]; Mid Point is [0.5859, 0.125]; End Point is [0.625, 0.0859]. - Line 5: Start Point is [0.625, 0.0859]; End Point is [0.625, 0.0]. - Line 6: Start Point is [0.625, 0.0]; End Point is [0.125, 0.0]. *Face 3:* Draw the third 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system. - Loop 1: - Line 1: Start Point is [0.625, 0.0]; End Point is [0.625, 0.0859]. - Arc 1: Start Point is [0.625, 0.0859]; Mid Point is [0.6641, 0.125]; End Point is [0.625, 0.1641]. - Line 2: Start Point is [0.625, 0.1641]; End Point is [0.625, 0.25]. - Arc 2: Start Point is [0.625, 0.25]; Mid Point is [0.75, 0.125]; End Point is [0.625, 0.0]. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the provided euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model, with an extrude depth of 0.125 towards the normal and 0.0 opposite the normal.</description>

<description>Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a square base and a square top The first part is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a square base and a square top, where the top is open, revealing an empty space inside. The sides of the prism are parallel and perpendicular to each other. The base and top of the prism are also perpendicular to the sides. The base and top share the same dimensions. The height of the prism is twice the length of the base. Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Create a new coordinate system for part 1 with the given Euler angles and translation vector: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.127, 0.0] Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch for the base Create a new sketch on the XY plane aligned to the created coordinate system and follow these steps for the base loops: Face 1: Loop 1: 1. Draw a line from (0, 0) to (0.75, 0) 2. Draw a line from (0.75, 0) to (0.75, 0.5357) 3. Draw a line from (0.75, 0.5357) to (0, 0.5357) 4. Draw a line from (0, 0.5357) to (0, 0) Loop 2: 1. Draw a line from (0.1743, 0.0925) to (0.6044, 0.0925) 2. Draw a line from (0.6044, 0.0925) to (0.6044, 0.4228) 3. Draw a line from (0.6044, 0.4228) to (0.1743, 0.4228) 4. Draw a line from (0.1743, 0.4228) to (0.1743, 0.0925) Step 3: Scale the 2D Sketch Scale the whole sketch by the given scaling parameter: Sketch Scale: 0.75 Step 4: Transform the scaled 2D Sketch into 3D Sketch Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector specified in the coordinate system. Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model Extrude the 2D sketch by twice the base length in the direction along the normal, and create a new solid body. Extrude depth: 0.127 (2 times the base length, as the base length is half of that value) Part 1 Completed Dimensions: - Shape: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a square base and a square top, open on top - Base Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.127 - Height: 0.75 This completes the instructions for constructing the first part of the CAD assembly.</description>
